channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2025020497
item.description:
Report X-2025020497

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-08
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A ONE GALLON COLEMAN BEVERAGE COOLER DUE TO BEING VERY COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 0.5 POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING A PLASTIC VACUUMED SEALED BAG OF AN UNKNOWN MATERIAL. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. THE SHIPPER INFORMATION ON THE THERMAL TRACKING LABEL DOES NOT HAVE A FULL SHIPPER ADDRESS VISIBLE. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER X837V1, OMH, 1035 CONGER ST, EUGENE OR 97402-6938. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: HAZMAT AUDITOR NOTIFIED RMP OF SUSPECTED REPEAT SHIPPER SENDING UNDECLARED BATTERY PACKAGES THROUGH UPS SYSTEM. RMP CALLED HMSC AND CONFIRMED CONTENTS WERE IN FACT THE SAME BATTERY AS PREVIOUSLY REPORTED CONFIRMED BY ADG COMPLIANCE TO BE UNDECLARED. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS: 1ZA4A5560394704954, 1ZA4A5560395943828, 1ZA4A5560397843914, 1ZA4A5560398263861, 1ZA4A5564298883814, 1ZA4A5560398311906, 1ZA4A5560399363877, 1ZA4A5560396011832, 1ZA4A5560392431172, 1ZA4A5560397983924, 1ZA4A5560394138567, 1ZA4A5560395487849, 1ZA4A5560395771853, 1ZA4A5560397987895, 1ZA4A5560391682788 AND 1ZA4A5560395471883

item.title: Report E-2025020126
item.description:
Report E-2025020126

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-10
  • City: CLACKAMAS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 17:32 EST, ERTS XPO Logistics (UPO) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 2 ounces of Foam Solvent Base Adhesive (hazardous - UN1133) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the container and did not impact the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product and damaged container will be placed into a 50-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release. ERTS will upload the BOL, SDS and create a waste container entry. ERTS contacted Charlie (Chemtrec) who provided report #2024011000151.

item.title: Report I-2025010054
item.description:
Report I-2025010054

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T00:57:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-30
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pax had spare lithium battery inside a pouch filled with pens and stickers. According to FA battery started to smoke and release a funky smell. Open opening they noticed that a camera battery had started expanding. Battery melt and charred some of the things that was around it. Appears one of the 3 batteries inside pouch started to smoke. It did char and melt some of the surrounding items. Was put inside BCB. After a thorough debrief with the flight attendants and the passenger involved, it appears the passenger was attempting to improvise a point-and-shopt style camera battery with wires and electrical tape to charge her iPod. Our passenger(seated in 32A) with the battery problem alerted the FA B & C after she noticed smoke and an electrical smell coming from the small fabric purse they were in. She reportedly leapt over her seat mates with the bag and brought it back to the aft galley and said something to the effect of "l have a battery fire in my bag." According to the flight attendants, the small amount of smoke and fumes that were present in the cabin quickly dissipated. 15 photos sent to FAA hazmat.

item.description:
Report X-2025020264

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-30
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED AFTER THE BOX FELT COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED AN INNER BOX WITH A GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARK CONTAINING A SINGLE ONE GALLON (3.79L) PLASTIC JUG OF MUELLER WHIZZER CONCENTRATE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
